Philips MRI Competencies

Competency AchievedCompetency Commentstraining / tasks carried out
Enter date & trainers initials when task is successfully completed:Comments: (multiple comments may be added at different stages of training)
InitialsDateObservedSupervisedIndependently
Scanner Room
I can use the controls of the User Interface Module (UIM) and tabletop to:
I can manually move the tabletop out of the bore using the tabletop release button.
I can safely use the laser light to center to the anatomy of interest for the examination.
I can move the table to isocenter.
I can locate the Flex Connect sockets on the tabletop
I can use the markers on the tabletop to note the extent of table movement.
I can state the weight limit for the tabletop. (250kg)
I can locate the head set and nurse call connection sockets
Flex Trak
I can use Flex Trak to safely transfer patients to the tabletop:
Verify that there are no magnetic objects present on the tabletop before entering the examination room.
Ensure wheels are locked during patient transfer.
Ensure the patient's extremities remain on the tabletop during transportation and docking to avoid injury.
I recognize that cardiac compression must never be performed on a patient who is on the Flex Trak.
Coils, accessories and positioning
I can identify coils and the examinations for which they are used.
I can inspect coils for damage and describe the effects of poor coil handling.
I can connect coils in a manner that prevents damage to the coil, connectors, cable, and tabletop.
I can position coil cables and infusion lines to prevent injury to the patient during table movement.
I can demonstrate the correct positioning of flex coils.
I can demonstrate the incorrect positioning of flex coils.
I can find additional coil information in the Instructions for Use.
I can safely store coils.
I can use accessories to:
Prevent skin to bore contact
Prevent skin to skin contact
Make the patient comfortable.
Immobilize the patient to reduce movement during the examination.
VCG
I can identify VCG components.
I can position the ECG electrodes on the patient.
I can position the wireless module on the patient.
I recognize that the VCG is not used for patient monitoring.
I can change and charge the battery on VCG module.
I can change the wireless network channel used by the VCG.
Respiratory sensor
I can identify the components of the respiratory sensor.
I can position the respiratory sensor on the patient.
I can change and charge the battery on respiratory sensor module.
I can change the wireless network channel used by the respiratory sensor.
Hearing protection and nurse call
I can apply hearing protection to the patient
I recognize that passive headphones donâ€™t allow for communication and may cause image artefacts.
I can securely position the nurse call button and provide instructions to the patient for its use.
With my 1.5T system, I know to use both earplugs and headphones for hearing protection.
Technical Room
I recognize that the MR system computer in the technical room controls the gradient amplifiers, magnet cooling system, RF transmitter, and receiver.
I know how to contact a remote service engineer who can supervise a full system shutdown when it is required and advised by the remote service engineer.
Emergency Magnet Stop Button
I can locate the emergency magnet off button.
I can describe the events and potential risks that occur when the emergency shut down is initiated.
I recognize the asphyxiation and burn dangers associated with release of cryogens that occurs during emergency shut down.
I can identify emergencies when the emergency magnet off button is used and not used.
I recognize that the emergency magnet off button (quench) is used only when there is risk of imminent danger.
Operator Room
Helium Level and PIQT
I can locate the helium level display.
I can respond to low helium levels message and notify.
I can follow Periodic Image Quality Testing (PIQT) procedures to perform quality assurance testing.
Communication with Patient
I can use the intercom system to:
I can use the intercom system to communicate with the patient.
Stop and resume table movement in an emergency
Adjust the music volume
Adjust the talk and listen volume
Turn the music on and off
View the nurse call light ring
I can visually monitor the patient during an examination
I can pause and resume a scan so that I can enter the scan room during the examination.
Online Help and instructions for use
I can display and navigate the online help.
I can access parameter help via the F1 key.
I can find and navigate the Instructions for Use.
I can find additional information on the info page.
I can display information about the coils for my system
Operator Console
Navigating the interface and using the mouse functions
I can navigate the user interface to:
Enter a new patient
View the Exam Card databases
View the Scan List
Review examination images
Switch between list view and thumbnail view
I can use the mouse to:
View the shortcut menu (right-click)
Window the display (middle button)
Zoom the display (middle and right button)
Pan the display (left and middle button)
Adjusting patient ventilation control
I can view the patient ventilation control.
I can adjust the patient ventilation as needed for patient comfort:
Using controls on the system and console. From the UIM.
I recognize the recommended patient ventilation level is Level 5.
Patient
I can enter a new patient for scanning:
I can enter a new patient for scanning.
I can select from the RIS, a patient for scanning. (If applicable)
I recognize that the system will scan in Normal SAR mode by default when the Pregnant Yes check box is selected.
I can use Scan Wise Implant to safely enter a new patient who has an MR Safe or MR Conditional implant.
I can navigate the patient tab to:
View the current patient
Review the previous patient
Preset protocol database
I recognize the types of Exam Cards and sequences contained in each Exam Card database
Philips preset procedures and Example Cards
Hospital
Other
I can display and navigate the Exam Card database to find an Exam Card or sequence:
I can view sequences in an Exam Card.
I can add the following to the Scan List:
Exam Card
Example Card (Philips predefined Exam Card)
Scan Protocols
Preset protocol database
I can save an Exam Card to the:
Hospital database
To another database
I can use a password to restrict access to the Hospital Exam Card database.
I can unlock the Hospital database to save an Exam Card (if needed).
I can create a new subfolder in the Hospital and Other databases.
Scan List
I can view the Exam Card properties.
I can modify the Scan List to:
Change the order of sequences
Repeat a sequence
Copy a sequence
Delete a sequence
I can hover the icons and labels on the Exam Card to identify their meaning.
I can view the status icons of a sequence to determine if the sequence:
Needs planning
Is ready to run
Is paused
Is scanning
Is completed
I can identify high SAR sequences.
I can override normal SAR mode when my patient might be pregnant.
I can view the SED indicator display to know when the SED level is low, medium, and high.
Scan List I can:
Save an Exam Card
Rename the Exam Card
Copy the Exam Card
Delete an Exam Card
Planning
Plan a sequence
I recognize that SmartSelect automatically selects the coils used in the examination.
I recognize that scans with the same geometry name (GeoName) within an ExamCard have the same:
Number of stacks
Off-center values for each stack
Angulations for each stack
Orientation
I can use propagate coverage to plan scans with the same GeoName.
I can use Propagate Coverage to share FOV, foldover direction, and coverage
I recognize that I should not use Propagate Coverage in a DWI series.
I can assign the correct GeoName to a scan.
I can add, delete, and modify the GeoName of a sequence.
I can display and hide the Planscan overlay (volume or the stack(s) of slices, REST slab, shim box, navigator).
I can use the Planscan toolbar and shortcut menu to plan the examination.
I can adjust the:
Slice gap.
Number of slices ï®
Field of view (FOV)
I can use flexible oversampling to ensure the entire anatomy is covered.
I can display and hide:
Box
3D view
All midplanes
Stack
Volume
Slab
I can view the Dashboard to see the effects of the planned protocol on:
Scan time
SAR
SED
Rel SNR
PNS
Technical Room
TR
I can view the SAR level for the scan.
I can view the SED level for the examination.
I can use the buttons in the Dashboard to undo, redo, accept, reset, and cancel changes.
I can view and change planning settings on the Summary tab:
FOV
Voxel
Matrix
Slice thickness and gap
NSA
Fat Suppression (SPIR)
I can view advanced parameter setting tabs.
I can reset the sequence settings to their original state using the undo button.
I can identify ExamCard items that use Propagate Coverage.
I can view conflicts and access assistance on the Conflicts tab.
I can enable AutoView for a sequence to view images during reconstruction.
I can identify sequences that have SmartLine (inline) postprocessing enabled.
I can view and modify the Info page to add site-specific notes regarding the ExamCard and scan.
Scan
I can manually start, pause, and restart a scan.
I recognize that pause scan and stop scan have different outcomes.
I can view in the Patient Status area:
Patient name
Physiology signal (if connected)
Scan progress bar
Exam card progress bar
Message line
SED
I can rescan failed scans.
Viewing Images
ImageView
I can use ImageView to view images.
I can switch between the thumbnail and ScanList views.
I can use the ImageView toolbar and the shortcut (right-click) menu to modify view settings.
Add and remove rows and columns
Use standard layouts
Play and pause a movie
Create text box
Measure the image
Select viewing display modes
Change settings
Review
I can display Review environment.
I can switch between List view and Thumbnail view.
I can use the various methods to navigate the image viewports and change the way the viewports display images using options in the:
Menu bar
Panel controls
Short cut (right-click) menus
Keyboard keys
I can use the mouse to:
Scroll
Zoom the display (middle and right button)
Panel controls
Change the window width and level
Reset the window, zoom and pan
I can use the Review toolbar and shortcut (right-click) menu to modify review settings.
Change the display to tiled or tabbed layout.
Link and unlink selected imaging series.
Capture a screen image and save it as a DICOM file.
Enable cross reference as:
Stack display
Box view
Slice mode
3D mode
I can use the Package Manager to switch between examinations/views and to stop the execution of packages.
I can display image information.
I can expand Series information.
I can display and hide Review Planscan to show planning.
I can annotate an image to show ROI, add labels, and lines.
I can use tools to measure in the image.
I can use print screen to capture an image.
I can use the Movie Toolbox to play, pause, and restart a movie.
I can save the reformatted images to the database.
Postprocessing
VolumeView
I can use VolumeView to select render modes (algorithms) to calculate projections and reformats of the source images.
I can choose the appropriate VolumeView render mode:
Maximum Intensity Projections (MIP)
Minimum Intensity Projections (MinIP)
Multiplanar Reformatting (MPR) rendering for 3D scans
Surface Rendering (shaded and unshaded surface)
I can use the tools in VolumeView to:
Navigate the view
Navigate the reference images
Change the reference views and lines.
Change the layout of a view
Draw contours.
Reset all settings
I can use presets:
Orientation
Zoom the display (middle and right button)
Slab thickness
PicturePlus
I can use PicturePlus to apply a filter to images to customize the appearance of the image for the radiologists preferences.
I can apply a Picture Plus preset to the image.
I can use the mouse to adjust smoothing and edge enhancement.
I can create a custom preset to define smoothing and edge enhancement values.
I can generate the modified series to save the new imaging series to the examination.
I recognize a series with prefix â€œeâ€ in the series name has been enhanced by PicturePlus.
MobiView
I can use the MobiView postprocessing package to fuse multi-station datasets.
I recognize that images must be acquired as different stacks in Head-Feet direction in order to use the MobiView postprocessing package.
I recognize that it is a best practice to keep the source images as well as the fused image.
I can check for artifacts before fusing images so that they are not mistakenly interpreted as pathologies.
Prior to fusing, I can select the best window option for the image series:
None
Automatic
MIP
I can select the appropriate fuse mode for the examination:
Fuse Hardcut
Fuse Smooth
Merge series
I can save the fused images to the patient database.
I can fuse a multi-station imaging series that includes multiple image types.
Administration
Saving examination data
I can save the examination to:
Local patient database
Queue DVD
DICOM network node
PACS
External hard drive
I can archive and delete examinations from the patient database.
I can enable Autopush to DICOM node.
I can print:
The entire examination
Selected images
Selected series
I can use Split Exam to save the examination images as multiple scan instances.
Storing and retrieving data from a USB drive
I can enable access to a removable USB drive.
I can import and export an ExamCard stored to a USB drive.
I can back-up the ExamCard database to a USB drive.
Data management
I can send and retrieve examination data from the data archive system (for example PACS).
I can send data to the data archive system and remove it from the database on the MR system to maintain good system performance.
I can save an examination to external media.
Examinations
Routine Brain
I can position the patient for a brain examination.
I recognize that some passive headsets may cause image artifacts.
I can position the Head coil and accessories.
I can add a routine brain Exam Card to the Scan List.
I can plan the brain examination.
I recognize that, when using SENSE, I must pay attention to the foldover direction and oversampling area to avoid foldover of anatomy outside the oversampling area.
I can post-process the brain examination using the Diffusion package.
Knee
See Knee Routine Workflow Guide
I can position the patient for a knee examination.
I can position the knee coil and accessories to reduce motion and improve patient comfort.
I can add the knee Exam Card to the Scan List.
I can plan the knee examination.
I can post-process the examination images.
Liver
I can position the patient for an abdomen examination.
I can position the abdomen coil and accessories to reduce motion and improve patient comfort.
I can position the respiratory sensor.
I can add the abdomen ExamCard to the ScanList.
I can plan the abdomen examination.
I can use breathhold and free breathing techniques to perform the examination.
I can use AutoVoice (if purchased) to communicate breathhold instructions to the patient.
I can post-process the abdomen images.
Spine
Refer to the Spine Workflow guide
I can position the patient for a spine examination.
I can position the spine coil and accessories to reduce motion and improve patient comfort.
I can add the spine ExamCard to the ScanList.
I can plan the spine examination.
I can post-process the spine images:
Use MobiView to fuse images
Use PicturePlus to enhance images
Use VolumeView for MPR and MIP reconstruction
Ankle
I can position the patient for an ankle examination.
I can position the ankle coil and accessories to reduce motion and improve patient comfort.
I can add the ankle ExamCard to the ScanList.
I can plan the ankle examination.
Position Shim volume
I can post-process the spine images
